info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 2:57PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Huerfano and southwestern Pueblo Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 255 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms across portions of southwest Pueblo County and northern Huerfano County. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Pueblo, Rye and Colorado City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southeastern Colorado.
